name: Charles T. Myers Golf Club
description: Municipal course in east Charlotte near I-85 and I-485. Features Mini Verde Bermuda greens, great elevation views, a 3-hole learner's course, and a state-of-the-art instruction facility. One of the highest points in Charlotte.

name: Dr. Charles L. Sifford Golf Course
description: Historic 9-hole course in South End with views of the Charlotte skyline. Named after the first African American to play on the PGA Tour. Bermuda grass tee to green. Great for a quick, affordable round. Rich history and a fun experience for all skill levels.

name: Harry L. Jones Sr. Golf Course
address: 7900 Harry L. Jones Sr. Dr, Charlotte, NC 28216
description: Located in southwest Charlotte near the airport. Long championship layout that challenges all skill levels. Features Bermuda from tee to green, a learner's course, and a driving range. One of the best municipal courses in the area. Getting new Bermuda greens in 2026.

name: Sunset Hills Golf Course
description: Old-school affordable course in northwest Mecklenburg County off Brookshire Blvd. Originally a farm pasture turned into a course. Features an 18-hole regulation course, a 9-hole learner's course, and a driving range. Bermuda tee to green. No-frills, budget-friendly golf.

name: The Tradition Golf Club
description: Cut through tall pines in northeast Charlotte near University area. Known as one of Charlotte's most challenging layouts. Tight, tree-lined fairways demand strategic shot-making. New Ultradwarf Bermudagrass greens and a Toptracer Range. Locals say it has the best greens in the area.

name: Highland Creek Golf Club
description: Winds through towering trees and meandering creeks in a residential community. Features Bermudagrass greens, 65+ bunkers, and water on 11 holes. Recently closed for renovation to hybrid Bermudagrass greens. Has a Beer Garden and Taproom with course views. Practice facility with range, 12,000 sq ft putting green, and practice bunker.

name: Charlotte National Golf Club
address: 6920 Howey Bottoms Rd, Indian Trail, NC 28079
description: An 18-hole course with 5 sets of tees for every level. Features lakes on several holes and 39 bunkers. Hosts the annual Margaritaville Golf Event and other charitable outings. Solid challenge without being punishing.

name: The Divide Golf Club
description: Stretches across Mecklenburg and Union Counties off I-485 in Matthews. Spacious Bermuda fairways with Diamond Zoysia greens. Water comes into play on several holes. The signature 18th is a 524-yard par 5 with an approach over water. Has a Toptracer Range. Fun mix of easy and difficult holes.

name: Rocky River Golf Club
description: Premier public course in the Charlotte/Concord area near Charlotte Motor Speedway. Routing flows through natural contours bordered by the Rocky River and wetlands. Famous for 'Gragg's Rock' â€” a massive boulder in the middle of the 3rd fairway. Part of the Embassy Suites resort. Consistently rated 4.5 stars. One of the best public options near Charlotte.

name: Birkdale Golf Club
description: Located in Huntersville within the Birkdale Village community. Challenging layout with a high slope rating for its length. Getting new Bermuda greens in 2026. A solid test that rewards accuracy over length.

name: Edgewater Golf Club
description: Built within a retirement community just across the SC state line. Features A1 bentgrass greens similar to Augusta National. A relatively young course that provides a great challenge. Check the hole-by-hole guide on their website before playing. One of the more unique experiences near Charlotte.

name: Emerald Lake Golf Club
description: Well-regarded course in the Matthews area. Solid layout with good variety. A mid-to-upper price option that delivers quality conditions and a good challenge for all levels.

name: Olde Sycamore Golf Plantation
description: Popular course in southeast Charlotte winding through a residential community. A well-maintained Tom Jackson design with good variety. Solid conditions and a nice clubhouse experience. One of the more consistently reviewed courses in the area.

name: Deer Brook Golf Club
description: Affordable public course in south Charlotte near Ballantyne. A good value option that provides a fair challenge without breaking the bank. Solid for a casual weekday round.

name: Skybrook Golf Club
description: Semi-private course winding through the Skybrook neighborhood in Huntersville. MiniVerde Bermudagrass greens and scenic views. A challenging but approachable layout. Head to SkyTop Grill after your round for flatbread pizza and a cold beer.

name: Eagle Chase Golf Club
description: Located east of Charlotte in Marshville. A shorter course that is forgiving yet fun. With 29 reviews on B-Man's Guide, it's one of the more talked-about courses in the area. Good value for the price, especially on weekdays.
